knimeNode.name: KNIME Space Connector
knimeNode.shortDescription: Provides a file system connection to access a KNIME Hub space.

intro.p: Provides a file system connection with access to a KNIME Hub space, for example the "Private" space on "My-KNIME-Hub". It is also possible to always connect to the space that contains the current workflow. The resulting output port allows downstream nodes to access files, e.g. to read or write, or to perform other file system operations (browse/list files, copy, move, ...) in the selected space. Files outside the configured space cannot be accessed.

Path syntax: Paths for this connector are specified with a UNIX-like syntax such as /myfolder/myfile. An absolute path consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the path to the file ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).

tab.name: Settings
tab.option:
Specify the space to access.
Current space: If chosen, the file system connection will give access to the space that contains the current workflow. If you are not using this connector node, this option is equivalent to choosing Read from > Relative to > Current space.
Other space: If chosen, the file system connection will give access to the selected space

If the Other space option is selected, this option allows to specify a mountpoint that connects to a KNIME Hub. Unconnected mountpoints are greyed out and can still be selected, but you need to go to the KNIME Explorer and connect the mountpoint before executing this node. A mountpoint is displayed in red if it was previously selected but is no longer available.
If the Other space option is selected, this option allows to specify a space within the currently selected mountpoint.

Specify the working directory of the resulting file system connection, using the Path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. The default working directory is "/".

ports.outPort: File system connection to the current space, or the selected space.
